notes.body: Hi Team,  PFB the VOS:  The image provided is intended solely to help new users understand how the sensor works and what components are generally required. It does not indicate that a transmitter or reader is included in this listing. As clearly stated in the very first sentence of the product description, “This listing includes only the sensor.”  A transmitter is required only once, while sensors need to be replaced regularly. This listing is specifically for the sensor only, and no part of the description or images suggests that additional items are included.  There is a separate listing available for customers who need the reader/transmitter, and that listing clearly shows the reader/transmitter in the product images.  We encourage customers to review product descriptions carefully before purchasing to ensure they select the correct listing for their needs.  Please inform the same to the customer and take the action accordingly.
notes.body_html:
Hi Team,

PFB the VOS:

The image provided is intended solely to help new users understand how the sensor works and what components are generally required. It does not indicate that a transmitter or reader is included in this listing. As clearly stated in the very first sentence of the product description, “This listing includes only the sensor.”

A transmitter is required only once, while sensors need to be replaced regularly. This listing is specifically for the sensor only, and no part of the description or images suggests that additional items are included.

There is a separate listing available for customers who need the reader/transmitter, and that listing clearly shows the reader/transmitter in the product images.

We encourage customers to review product descriptions carefully before purchasing to ensure they select the correct listing for their needs.

Please inform the same to the customer and take the action accordingly.

notes.body: Hello Chandra,     Greetings from PharmEasy!  ​   ​With regards to your order #658710153786843136-20077, I see your order is under process and the medicines are being arranged. The estimated delivery date is 13th December 2025.     I would like to inform you that the estimated date of delivery depends on the availability of the medicines and the delivery pin code. Also, be informed that PharmEasy will always try to ensure that your order is delivered at the earliest as we completely understand the urgency of the medicine.  ​ Your order will be delivered within the estimated delivery date committed at the time of order placement. Your patience and understanding are highly appreciated in the meantime.   ​   For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.     Regards,  Manisha

notes.body:
Inspite of multiple calls and emails the URGENT ORDER ID 658710153786843136
has’nt been delivered on time as promised and delayed. On my calls to
customer care representatives Mr Shahbaz and Mr Salman , I have told them
beforehand only to get unavailable 1 Strip of Revital H removed and get the
remaining order medicines delivered Urgently today itself , they promised
the same ,that they will modify the order and remove Revital H 1 strip and
get my remaining medicines of 2 TRESIBA Cartriges and cofsils delivered
today itself but total failure and unprofessional attitude of failing to
deliver something when committed.The life saving medicines like Tresiba
Insulin cartridge were needed Urgently.
           Such unprofessional behaviour and failing to deliver urgently
required medicines is least expected . Kindly look into the above matter
and do the needful and get my remaining order medicines  delivered URGENTLY
ON PRIORITY BASIS.

Harsh Sinha,
7398799569

We had ordered medicines on Pharmeasy on 6/12/2025. When we confirmed the
order, the price of the medicines was Rs. 1392.8. However on delivery, we
were asked to pay an additional Rs. 135. When I checked online, it seemed
like the price of the medicines had increased to Rs. 1521. We did pay the
additional Rs. 135 since we needed the medicines, however, this is a very
bad customer experience.

Can you help explain the sudden increase in the price and if possible, help
with refund the additional amount?

Order No: 656178350384812032

Best,
Aniket

We had ordered medicines on Pharmeasy on 6/12/2025. When we confirmed the order, the price of the medicines was Rs. 1392.8. However on delivery, we were asked to pay an additional Rs. 135. When I checked online, it seemed like the price of the medicines had increased to Rs. 1521. We did pay the additional Rs. 135 since we needed the medicines, however, this is a very bad customer experience. 

Can you help explain the sudden increase in the price and if possible, help with refund the additional amount?

Aniket

notes.body: Hello Aniket,     Greetings from PharmEasy!      I understand your query is related to the order #656178350384812032-23516. I see that the price of LACOMA T BOTTLE OF 2.5ML EYE DROPS was updated from Rs. 422.81 to Rs. 462.19. Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused.   Also, I would like to inform you that the products listed in the app is not linked to the price. Thus, we share the estimated cost at the time of order placement, which can be either higher or lower than the actual price. We send you an SMS/push notification for the total discounted amount that needs to be paid as soon as your medicines are procured.   Sometimes, the MRP of the medicines may vary depending on the stock received by the chemist. This price variation will always be due to price changes by the medicine manufacturer. However, if the pricing on the medicine packaging differs from what is printed on the bill, please get back to us with the image of the medicine highlighting the batch number so that we can get the issue resolved.  ​   For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.     Regards,  Manisha
notes.body_html:
Hello Aniket,

Greetings from PharmEasy! 

I understand your query is related to the order #656178350384812032-23516. I see that the price of LACOMA T BOTTLE OF 2.5ML EYE DROPS was updated from Rs. 422.81 to Rs. 462.19. Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused.

Also, I would like to inform you that the products listed in the app is not linked to the price. Thus, we share the estimated cost at the time of order placement, which can be either higher or lower than the actual price. We send you an SMS/push notification for the total discounted amount that needs to be paid as soon as your medicines are procured.

Sometimes, the MRP of the medicines may vary depending on the stock received by the chemist. This price variation will always be due to price changes by the medicine manufacturer. However, if the pricing on the medicine packaging differs from what is printed on the bill, please get back to us with the image of the medicine highlighting the batch number so that we can get the issue resolved.
​
For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.

Regards,
Manisha

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Hi Team,     ​Here is phlebo error and we can take the corrective action against phlebo  And same has inform to cx via email, on call cx said give revert on mail.        Regards,  Shruti Vaviya  Complaints  

                           

                            On

                            Sat, 13 Dec at 12:37 PM

                            ,  Grievance Officer <grievance-officer@pharmeasy.in>  wrote:

                             

 Team, 

   

 Kindly check if this belongs to us. 

   

   Regards, Grievance Helpdesk  

   

   ---------- Forwarded message --------- 

  

 

  

 From: Sanjib Saha <kumarsanjib_2000@yahoo.com> Date: Sat, Dec 13, 2025 at 1:56 AM Subject: Re: FEEDBACK: Your Appointment is Confirmed- Appointment ID- 744788917 Date of Appointment-12/12/2025 To: hello@getvisitapp.com <hello@getvisitapp.com>, wellness@thyrocare.com <wellness@thyrocare.com> Cc: gro@careinsurance.com <gro@careinsurance.com>, Grievance Officer <grievance-officer@pharmeasy.in>, PharmEasy <care@pharmeasy.in>, Deepanshu Bhatia <deepanshubhatia@policybazaar.com>, PolicyBazaar <care@policybazaar.com>   

 

 

 

 

 Hi, 

   

 Even after written reminder through mail trail communication regarding proper hygienic measures I had a very disappointing experience today morning when the collecting agent turned up almost half an hour ago and WITHOUT ANY MASK. 

   

 When I had asked him about the mask before allowing him to enter, he mentioned that he will wear inside, but he wasn't wearing anything...... again I had to remind him about the mask and then he said he forgot it in the bike and will manage with his helmet and in the middle of preparation he suggested to go down from 4th floor to bring his mask which I found already too late.   

   

 What kind of agents do you hire for sample collection that they think helmet can be used as a replacement for the mask? I never found such intelligent folks in Bangalore where ALL collection agents were very disciplined irrespective of the organization or hospital they belong to.  

   

  Also this agent was not wearing clean clothes, neither well-groomed and surprisingly, I noticed him keeping all used gloves in a side pocket of his bag; not sure what is the purpose of collecting such used gloves.  

   

 

I understand, it could be a regional nuisance; but that can't be an excuse as we depend on the brand name and can't put our health at risk due to such basic negligence, especially when other senior citizens are at home. 

 

   

 He called me form mobile number 7949106890 and I doubt whether any replacement person was sent in place of the originally assigned agent, because till now I am having a weird kind of pain passing through nerves in my left hand which I never experienced before.

 

   

 I recall during my previous appointment with Thyrocare booked through BEATO in July 2025 (booked through same mobile for my mother) when this Mr. Bidhan Sadhu called me prior evening, I had an argument with him regarding genuineness of PharmEasy in such location, because agent in Bangalore told me that they don't get access of customer's number unless one hour before appointment and next morning I got to know that Mr. Sadhu refused my appointment and hence, Mr Hritik Shaw had to come from a very distant place Raniganj, but he took all precautionary measures. 

   

  Also I would like to highlight that parameters of KFT in Thyrocare is different from other organization / hospitals and doesn't include basic salts Na & K, but generally all doctors look for three basic salts Na/K/Ca; not sure why such health package is recommended form CARE and it is a paid rider. 

   

 PS: Just a while ago I received SMS notification at 12:32 am that sample collected in the morning has reached the lab now.  

   

  Regards,  Sanjib Kumar Saha  

   

  

 

           

   

        

         

 

             

                

                 

                        On Wednesday 10 December, 2025 at 09:02:32 pm IST,  <hello@getvisitapp.com> wrote:

                     

                       

                       

                

                

                  

 

 

Dear User, Greetings!

 

 Apologies for the inconvenience caused to you. 

 As per your concern, please find below the list of tests included: 

 

 

 Calcium – Total 

 

 

 Complete Blood Count (CBC) 

 

 

 Complete Urine Routine Analysis (CUE) 

 

 

 Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) 

 

 

 Blood Sugar (Fasting) 

 

 

 Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH) 

 

 

 Uric Acid 

 

 

 Kidney Function Test (Basic): BUN, BUN/Creatinine Ratio, Urea, Creatinine, Uric Acid 

 

 

 Liver Function Test (LFT) 

 

 

 Lipid Profile 

 

 

 HbA1c (Glycosylated Hemoglobin) 

 

 

 Vitamin D3 (25 Hydroxy) 

 

 

 Additionally, we have checked and found that your appointment is reflected as confirmed. If you face any further issues, please feel free to reach out to us. We will be happy to assist you. 

 

Regards, Visit Health Support Team 

 

 

 

 On Dec 10, 2025 at 5:03 PM Sanjib Kumar Saha wrote:  

 

 Can you please share all tests name in detail?

   

 Also please ensure sample collection agent must wear mask, gloves and take all hygienic precautions. 

 

 

 Regards,

 Sanjib Saha

To: hello@getvisitapp.com <hello@getvisitapp.com>, wellness@thyrocare.com <wellness@thyrocare.com>
Cc: gro@careinsurance.com <gro@careinsurance.com>, Grievance Officer <grievance-officer@pharmeasy.in>, PharmEasy <care@pharmeasy.in>, Deepanshu Bhatia <deepanshubhatia@policybazaar.com>, PolicyBazaar <care@policybazaar.com>


Hi,

Even after written reminder through mail trail communication regarding proper hygienic measures I had a very disappointing experience today morning when the collecting agent turned up almost half an hour ago and WITHOUT ANY MASK.
 
When I had asked him about the mask before allowing him to enter, he mentioned that he will wear inside, but he wasn't wearing anything...... again I had to remind him about the mask and then he said he forgot it in the bike and will manage with his helmet and in the middle of preparation he suggested to go down from 4th floor to bring his mask which I found already too late.  

What kind of agents do you hire for sample collection that they think helmet can be used as a replacement for the mask? I never found such intelligent folks in Bangalore where ALL collection agents were very disciplined irrespective of the organization or hospital they belong to. 

 Also this agent was not wearing clean clothes, neither well-groomed and surprisingly, I noticed him keeping all used gloves in a side pocket of his bag; not sure what is the purpose of collecting such used gloves. 

I understand, it could be a regional nuisance; but that can't be an excuse as we depend on the brand name and can't put our health at risk due to such basic negligence, especially when other senior citizens are at home.

He called me form mobile number 7949106890 and I doubt whether any replacement person was sent in place of the originally assigned agent, because till now I am having a weird kind of pain passing through nerves in my left hand which I never experienced before.

I recall during my previous appointment with Thyrocare booked through BEATO in July 2025 (booked through same mobile for my mother) when this Mr. Bidhan Sadhu called me prior evening, I had an argument with him regarding genuineness of PharmEasy in such location, because agent in Bangalore told me that they don't get access of customer's number unless one hour before appointment and next morning I got to know that Mr. Sadhu refused my appointment and hence, Mr Hritik Shaw had to come from a very distant place Raniganj, but he took all precautionary measures.

 Also I would like to highlight that parameters of KFT in Thyrocare is different from other organization / hospitals and doesn't include basic salts Na & K, but generally all doctors look for three basic salts Na/K/Ca; not sure why such health package is recommended form CARE and it is a paid rider.

PS: Just a while ago I received SMS notification at 12:32 am that sample collected in the morning has reached the lab now. 

Regards, 
Sanjib Kumar Saha

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Dear Pharmeasy customer service team.

I am writing to formally raise a complaint regarding the lack of response
and information from your side despite sending multiple emails.

I had placed a medicine order with cash on delivery mode payment.  The
delivery was delayed beyond the committed time frame, for which I
emailed you customer support on 29 November requesting resolution and
refund of Rs 56/-
As compensation.

However even after sending repetitive follow-up emails , I have not
recieved any clear information,  resolution or refund . This reflects poor
customer service and Negligence towards customer grievances .

Details of Issues
1) Order Date - 29 November
2) payment mode - cash on delivery
3) Issues - Delayed delivery and No response despite repeated reminders
emails .
4) pending Refund- 56/-

The absence of any update or accountability even after multiple reminders,
has caused mental harassment and inconvenience.

I request you to

1) provide a clear written response immediately.
2) credit the pending refund of Rs 56/- without further delay .
3) ensure such Negligence is not repeated in the future .

If this Issues is not resolved within 48 hrs I will be compelled to
escalate the matter to higher authorities and appropriate consumer
greviences forum's.

Kindly treat this matter as urgent basis .

Sincerely
Praveen Kumar Bohare
8384012207, 8303629486
BOHAREPRAVEEN040@GMAIL.COM

--

helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
Dear Pharmeasy customer service team. 

I am writing to formally raise a complaint regarding the lack of response and information from your side despite sending multiple emails. 

I had placed a medicine order with cash on delivery mode payment.  The delivery was delayed beyond the committed time frame, for which I emailed you customer support on 29 November requesting resolution and refund of Rs 56/- 
As compensation. 

However even after sending repetitive follow-up emails , I have not recieved any clear information,  resolution or refund . This reflects poor customer service and Negligence towards customer grievances .

Details of Issues 
1) Order Date - 29 November 
2) payment mode - cash on delivery 
3) Issues - Delayed delivery and No response despite repeated reminders emails .
4) pending Refund- 56/-

The absence of any update or accountability even after multiple reminders,  has caused mental harassment and inconvenience. 

I request you to 

1) provide a clear written response immediately. 
2) credit the pending refund of Rs 56/- without further delay .
3) ensure such Negligence is not repeated in the future .

If this Issues is not resolved within 48 hrs I will be compelled to escalate the matter to higher authorities and appropriate consumer greviences forum's. 

Kindly treat this matter as urgent basis .

Sincerely 
Praveen Kumar Bohare 
8384012207, 8303629486
BOHAREPRAVEEN040@GMAIL.COM

notes.body: Hello Praveen,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     With regards to your order #653307221534023680-58848, I see that due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.     As per the records, your order was delivered to you on 30th November 2025. I have jotted down the details of your experience, and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future. Please be informed as a token of apology, we have credited Rs. 50 to your PharmEasy wallet.      At the time of placing the order, you selected Cash on Delivery (COD) as the payment method. Please note that in the location 201016, free COD service is not available. Therefore, a cash processing charge was applied to this order, and the same amount was collected by our delivery executive. For your reference and further clarification, I have attached the service invoice below.     Please note that the cash processing fee is not refundable.    We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.     For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay healthy!     Regards,  Manisha
notes.body_html:
Hello Praveen,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to your order #653307221534023680-58848, I see that due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.

As per the records, your order was delivered to you on 30th November 2025. I have jotted down the details of your experience, and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future. Please be informed as a token of apology, we have credited Rs. 50 to your PharmEasy wallet.

At the time of placing the order, you selected Cash on Delivery (COD) as the payment method. Please note that in the location 201016, free COD service is not available. Therefore, a cash processing charge was applied to this order, and the same amount was collected by our delivery executive. For your reference and further clarification, I have attached the service invoice below.

Please note that the cash processing fee is not refundable.

We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay healthy!

Regards,
Manisha

      Subject: Incorrect Refund Amount credit 50 /- instead of 56/-  
      Description:  
 Subject: Incorrect Refund Amount Credited – ₹50 Instead of ₹56 
   
 Dear PharmEasy Team, 
   
 I am writing to inform you that I have received an email regarding a refund of ₹50, whereas the approved refund amount was ₹56. 
   
 This refund is related to my complaint for delayed delivery (Cash on Delivery order), for which I had raised the issue on 29 November. The short credit of ₹6 has not been explained, and no justification has been provided for deducting the amount. 
   
 Issue Details: 
   
 Expected Refund: ₹56 
   
 Refund Intimated: ₹50 
   
 Difference Amount: ₹6 
   
   
 Kindly clarify the reason for the deduction and credit the remaining ₹6 to my PharmEasy wallet at the earliest. 
   
 Please resolve this discrepancy immediately and confirm once the full refund is processed. 
   
 In case of no response or correction, I will be constrained to escalate the matter to higher authorities and consumer grievance platforms. 
   
 Sincerely, 
 Name: Praveen Sharma

notes.body: Hello Praveen Kumar,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     This email is in regards to your order #653307221534023680-58848.     Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused.     As per update received from our team, please be informed that refund of Rs..5/- will be credited to your PharmEasy wallet witing 24-48 hpurs as there was delay in priority delivery order. To check your PharmEasy wallet balance, go to the accounts section and click on the Wallet section to see the balance amount. Your PharmEasy wallet balance will be adjusted in your next order.     We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.     For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels, on the App or website, listed in the "Need Help" section.     Thank you for being a PharmEasy customer.     Regards,  PharmEasy
notes.body_html:
Hello Praveen Kumar,

Greetings from PharmEasy!
 
This email is in regards to your order #653307221534023680-58848.

Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused.
 
As per update received from our team, please be informed that refund of Rs..5/- will be credited to your PharmEasy wallet witing 24-48 hpurs as there was delay in priority delivery order. To check your PharmEasy wallet balance, go to the accounts section and click on the Wallet section to see the balance amount. Your PharmEasy wallet balance will be adjusted in your next order.
 
We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.
 
For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels, on the App or website, listed in the "Need Help" section.
 
Thank you for being a PharmEasy customer.
 
Regards,
PharmEasy

notes.body: Hello ​Khuman,     Greetings from PharmEasy!   ​   This email is with regards to your order #654512159102574592-66984, I see your concern was highlighted for the missing item. I apologize for any inconvenience caused to you with your order.   We have received an update from our escalations team. As per the update, all the medicines were packed and dispatched properly. I am sorry, we will be unable to comply with your refund request. Please be informed that the update was shared with you after a thorough check.   I highly appreciate your understanding in this regard.  ​   For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.     Regards,  Manisha

notes.body_html:
Hello Dr. Pramit,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to your order #657342153332391936-30918, as checked due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.

As per the records, your order is delivered to you on 13th December 2025. We have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future.

We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section. 

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!

Regards,
PharmEasy

notes.body: Hello Vimal,     Greetings from PharmEasy!   ​   With regards to the promotional notifications, we always try to keep our customers updated on our offers. However, we apologize for the inconvenience caused due to our promotional messages.   Please be assured, I have forwarded your request to unsubscribe your number '8438266547' from getting the promotional notifications. It will take 3 working days to process it completely. You will only receive your order-related information.   Further, if you wish to unsubscribe from getting the promotional notifications on your email id too, I request you to open your latest promotional email and hit unsubscribe at the bottom right-hand side corner to stop email promotions.   I certainly hope this helps and appreciate your understanding and patience in the meanwhile.   ​   For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.     Regards,  Manisha
notes.body_html:
Hello Vimal,

Greetings from PharmEasy! 
​
With regards to the promotional notifications, we always try to keep our customers updated on our offers. However, we apologize for the inconvenience caused due to our promotional messages.

Please be assured, I have forwarded your request to unsubscribe your number '8438266547' from getting the promotional notifications. It will take 3 working days to process it completely. You will only receive your order-related information.

Further, if you wish to unsubscribe from getting the promotional notifications on your email id too, I request you to open your latest promotional email and hit unsubscribe at the bottom right-hand side corner to stop email promotions.

I certainly hope this helps and appreciate your understanding and patience in the meanwhile. 
​
For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.

Regards,
Manisha
